intro: Pedicellia loureiroi, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. It has strap-like, grassy leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
